locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the historical and theological reality of the Resurrection against the backdrop of modern skepticism, generic spirituality, and global conflict (Israel-Palestine). It uses Paul's letters to define God as the one who creates ex nihilo.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher connects the Pauline 'God who raises the dead' to the Exodus tradition and the specific context of the Corinthian 'generic spirituality'.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher moves from refuting skepticism (Assertive) to proclaiming the specific promise of resurrection and reconciliation (Commissive/Declarative).
voorbeelden: God raised Jesus from the dead.
He will raise us also with Jesus.
Rejoice today.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from vague religious sentiment to a concrete hope that transforms their view of current suffering and death.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The preacher speaks of God creating faith where there is none, which is the Spirit's work, but the Spirit is not explicitly named as the agent of the sermon-event.

voorbeelden: The Easter season is not even half over.
Paul was a man to be reckoned with.
The terrorist infrastructure lies within peopleâ€™s hearts.
Now listen to this.
Rejoice today.
Count yourselves profoundly blessed if you answer 'yes'.
I wonder.
I spend a good deal of time with people...
This is unfortunate verging on calamitous.
He will raise us also with Jesus.
God will do this. He has promised it.
God... will bring us with you into his presence.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong. The preacher uses the future tense not as a prediction, but as a divine commitment grounded in the past act of the Resurrection.

voorbeelden: Christ is risen!
The Lord is risen indeed!
Dear people of God...
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate. The sermon relies heavily on quoting Paul's authority rather than the preacher speaking directly in the persona Christi, though the final acclamation is a pure declarative.

indicatoren: Extensive discussion of the British Navy and Admiral Nelson.
Detailed reporting on CNN interviews and New York Times columns.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually persuaded but may remain an observer of the 'Resurrection idea' rather than a participant in the 'Resurrection event' until the very end.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the hearer's specific 'deadness' in the first person
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: A delay in the 'encounter' until the final third of the sermon.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High. The repetition of 'He will raise us' functions as a true Commissive.
voorbeelden: The God who has raised the Lord Jesus will raise us also with Jesus.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Anecdotal and homiletical ('I wonder', 'I spend time').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct questioning ('Do you believe?') and final address ('Dear people of God').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to bridge the promise to the specific congregation.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant. Talking about Paul, the Corinthians, the media, and God in the abstract.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere in the first half.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Historical defense of the Resurrection and Paul's ministry.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about God's nature and the state of the world.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of the Easter season and the final proclamation.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon moves from the Assertive (The Resurrection happened) to the Commissive (God will raise you) to the Directive (Rejoice).
voorbeelden: God raised Jesus (Assertive) -> He will raise us also (Commissive) -> Rejoice today (Directive).
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The link (Toezegging) is the strongest part of the sermon's structure.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: For this is the God who raises the dead... Rejoice today.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a powerful evangelical witness that moves from intellectual defense to a comforting promise. It narrowly avoids 'Informative Teaching' by the strength of its final commissives.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: He who raised the Lord Jesus will raise us also with Jesus.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a solid foundation for faith beyond emotion.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The lengthy section on Admiral Nelson and Elvis.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Spends too much time on analogies that illustrate 'talking about' rather than 'doing'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event in the final third when the preacher stops arguing with skeptics and starts promising to the congregation.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of the 'Toezegging' (Promise) functions as a means of grace.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, God is portrayed as the one whose Word creates reality.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Partially; the preacher speaks as a witness to Paul's witness.
tekstueel_bewijs: God... calls into existence the things that do not exist.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to God's power to 'create faith'.
tekstueel_bewijs: He can create faith where there is no faith.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon aims to be the vehicle for the Resurrection power it describes.
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is the living Son of God, present in all his risen power.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from descriptive past-tense verbs (about Paul/history) to present-tense performative verbs (addressing the hearer).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The New Testament says that what happened on Easter Day is beyond the imagination of man.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, God does a work in you that is beyond your imagination.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a report about the NT to a present-tense act of God upon the hearer.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The toezegging is already the strongest element.
voorbeeldzinnen: God raises you from your despair today.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'you' to implicate the hearer in the 'terrorist infrastructure' of the heart earlier.
voorbeeldzinnen: The infrastructure of sin in your heart is being dismantled now.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A robust theological sermon that successfully transitions from apology to proclamation. To reach 'Sacramental Creative' status, reduce the anecdotal locution and increase direct declarative address.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about her doubts; SAT focuses on the 'illocutionary force' of the divine promise regardless of the preacher's inner state.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric seeks to persuade the hearer that the Resurrection is 'plausible'; SAT seeks to 'perform' the Resurrection through the word of promise.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is concentrated in the Commissive 'He will raise us,' which functions as a linguistic anchor for the hearer's future.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: He who raised the Lord Jesus will raise us also with Jesus.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Excellent; it is the sacramental pivot of the text.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Theological Proclamation' that struggles slightly with the weight of its own introductory 'talking about' (constative surplus) but recovers beautifully in the peroration.
